This is a fairly standard (and sometimes preferred) link format — omitting the protocol before the `//` indicates that the link should use the same protocol as the referring page. In most cases, this would communicate “continue using HTTPS” to the browser. If a tool is flagging this as a potential SEO issue, that is very assuredly a false positive.

As to why your links are being formatted in this way: I can’t say for certain, but this type of link is relevant when there are multiple valid access protocols — in the case of HubSpot CMS, that’s going to be HTTP and HTTPS. So, my hunch is that you may not be forcing HTTPS in your domain settings, so protocol-agnostic links would be necessary.

To check this, go to your settings panel and navigate to Tools > Website > Domains & URLs > [your domain] > Edit > Update domain security settings > Force HTTPS.
Now that HubSpot’s HubL plugin for Prettier seems to be abandoned, does anyone know if there are any alternative formatters for HubL that might be worth looking at?
